471 launched a boat to bring the fishermen on board.

The prolonged cold weather has
affected the lives of people in many
countries around the world.
and America, traveling on the road with
an electric vehicle faces many
challenges. Every time these people prepare to go
out, Mr. Caran must check the
battery status and the number of kilometers that his electric vehicle
can normally travel.  The car
can go 130 km on a full battery, but the
distance will be reduced to only half in
cold weather, not to mention the fact that it
can die in the middle of the road when it's
cold like this, I have no
choice.  Other than renting
a gasoline car, for
gasoline or diesel cars, if you encounter problems, you
can push the car to the summer, but
electric cars are much more difficult because the steering wheel
and wheels cannot move.
Meanwhile in the US, electric car charging stations
accidentally become stalled parking lots.
You have to heat the battery to the ideal temperature to
charge it, but with
temperatures below minus 10° C like this, that's not possible.  It is
very difficult for electric cars to be better for the environment
than gasoline cars. However, electric car drivers
need to be prepared to avoid
problems in the cold weather. This
morning, a vehicle carrying 60 tons of
liquefied natural gas  exploded and caused a
large fire in Mongolia's capital Ulat. The
incident left at least six people dead
and 14
injured. Mongolia's national emergency management agency
Neymar received an
emergency phone call.  Reported the
above incident at around 1:00 a.m. local time.
According to initial information, the
fuel tanker exploded after
colliding with another car. Both vehicles were
burned down and the street was extensively damaged.
and the glass windows of a nearby school
were broken due to the impact of the explosion. According to
local media, a large fire
also engulfed several nearby buildings.
Among the dead were three
firefighters. There were also three firefighters.  Many young children were
injured. More than 600 firefighters and
100 vehicles were mobilized to
control the fire. The local government
temporarily evacuated residents living near the
scene and blocked
surrounding roads to allow firefighters to escape.

three admitted their crimes. The
